// --- Data Types --- export interface VaultRequest { userId: string; personaId: string; data: any; authToken: string; } export interface VaultResponse { success: boolean; message: string; data?: any; entry_id?: string; } export interface AuditEvent { id: string; user_id: string; action: string; resource_id?: string; timestamp: string; metadata?: any; } // --- Secure Vault Client --- export class SecureVaultClient { /** * Store data in the secure vault * Fixed to match Rust function signature with individual parameters */ static async store(request: VaultRequest): Promise { try { console.log('[SecureVaultClient] About to store with request:', JSON.stringify(request, null, 2)); console.log('[SecureVaultClient] Mapping to individual parameters for Rust function signature'); return await invoke('vault_store', { userId: request.userId, personaId: request.personaId, data: request.data, authToken: request.authToken, }); } catch (error) { console.error('[SecureVaultClient] Store error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to store data: ${error}`); } } /** * Retrieve data from the secure vault */ static async retrieve(userId: string, personaId: string, authToken: string): Promise { try { const params = { userId, personaId, authToken }; console.log('[SecureVaultClient] About to retrieve with params:', JSON.stringify(params, null, 2)); return await invoke('vault_retrieve', params); } catch (error) { console.error('[SecureVaultClient] Retrieve error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to retrieve data: ${error}`); } } /** * Delete data from the secure vault */ static async delete(userId: string, personaId: string, authToken: string): Promise { try { const params = { userId, personaId, authToken }; console.log('[SecureVaultClient] About to delete with params:', JSON.stringify(params, null, 2)); return await invoke('vault_delete', params); } catch (error) { console.error('[SecureVaultClient] Delete error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to delete data: ${error}`); } } /** * Get audit log for a user */ static async getAuditLog(userId: string, authToken: string): Promise { try { const params = { userId, authToken }; console.log('[SecureVaultClient] About to get audit log with params:', JSON.stringify(params, null, 2)); return await invoke('vault_get_audit_log', params); } catch (error) { console.error('[SecureVaultClient] Audit log error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to get audit log: ${error}`); } } } // --- App Status Client --- export class AppStatusClient { /** * Get basic app status */ static async getAppStatus(): Promise { try { return await invoke('get_app_status'); } catch (error) { console.error('[AppStatusClient] Get app status error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to get app status: ${error}`); } } /** * Basic greeting command */ static async greet(name: string): Promise { try { return await invoke('greet', { name }); } catch (error) { console.error('[AppStatusClient] Greet error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to greet: ${error}`); } } } // --- Authentication Client --- export class AuthClient { private static userId: string | null = null; private static authToken: string | null = null; /** * Set authentication credentials */ static setCredentials(userId: string, authToken: string): void { this.userId = userId; this.authToken = authToken; console.log('[AuthClient] Credentials set for user:', userId); } /** * Get current user ID */ static getUserId(): string | null { return this.userId; } /** * Get current auth token */ static getAuthToken(): string | null { return this.authToken; } /** * Check if user is authenticated */ static isAuthenticated(): boolean { return this.userId !== null && this.authToken !== null; } /** * Clear current credentials */ static clearCredentials(): void { this.userId = null; this.authToken = null; console.log('[AuthClient] Credentials cleared'); } /** * Generate demo credentials for testing * Uses a consistent userId to avoid "user mismatch" errors */ static generateDemoCredentials(): { userId: string; authToken: string } { const userId = 'default-user'; // Consistent userId for demo/testing // Use the demo_token format that auth.rs accepts without signature verification const authToken = `demo_token_${Date.now()}_${Math.random().toString(36).substring(2)}`; this.setCredentials(userId, authToken); console.log('[AuthClient] Generated demo credentials:', { userId, tokenLength: authToken.length, tokenFormat: 'demo_token' }); return { userId, authToken }; } } // --- Hearthlink Client (Main Interface) --- export class HearthlinkClient { /** * Initialize the client with authentication */ static async initialize(): Promise<{ userId: string; authToken: string }> { console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Initializing...'); if (!AuthClient.isAuthenticated()) { const credentials = AuthClient.generateDemoCredentials(); console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Generated demo credentials:', credentials); const result = { userId: credentials.userId, authToken: credentials.authToken, }; console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Returning initialized credentials:', JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)); return result; } const result = { userId: AuthClient.getUserId()!, authToken: AuthClient.getAuthToken()!, }; console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Returning existing credentials:', JSON.stringify(result, null, 2)); return result; } /** * Send a voice message (simplified for vault demo) */ static async sendVoiceMessage(message: string, agent: string): Promise { const { userId, authToken } = await this.initialize(); try { console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Storing voice message in vault...'); // Store the user message in vault first await SecureVaultClient.store({ userId, personaId: agent, data: { type: 'user_message', message, timestamp: Date.now(), agent, }, authToken, }); console.log('[HearthlinkClient] Voice message stored successfully'); // Return a demo response for testing return { success: true, message: 'Voice message processed and stored securely', agent_response: `Demo response from ${agent}: I received your message "${message}"` }; } catch (error) { console.error('[HearthlinkClient] Voice message error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to send voice message: ${error}`); } } } // --- Alden Client (Tauri IPC) --- export class AldenClient { /** * Generate response from Alden persona */ static async generate(message: string, sessionId?: string, context?: any): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[AldenClient] Generating response...'); try { const response = await invoke('alden_generate', { userId, message, sessionId, context }); console.log('[AldenClient] Response received:', response); return response; } catch (error) { console.error('[AldenClient] Generation error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to generate response: ${error}`); } } /** * Get Alden's current status and metrics */ static async getStatus(): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[AldenClient] Getting status...'); try { const status = await invoke('alden_get_status', { userId }); console.log('[AldenClient] Status received:', status); return status; } catch (error) { console.error('[AldenClient] Status error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to get status: ${error}`); } } /** * Update Alden's trait (user customization) */ static async updateTrait(traitName: string, newValue: number, reason?: string): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[AldenClient] Updating trait:', traitName, '=', newValue); try { const result = await invoke('alden_update_trait', { userId, traitName, newValue, reason }); console.log('[AldenClient] Trait updated:', result); return result; } catch (error) { console.error('[AldenClient] Update trait error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to update trait: ${error}`); } } /** * Export Alden's memory for user review */ static async exportMemory(): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[AldenClient] Exporting memory...'); try { const memory = await invoke('alden_export_memory', { userId }); console.log('[AldenClient] Memory exported'); return memory; } catch (error) { console.error('[AldenClient] Export memory error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to export memory: ${error}`); } } } // --- Synapse Client (Tauri IPC) --- export class SynapseClient { /** * Create a new user pattern insight */ static async createInsight( discoveringPersona: string, patternTitle: string, patternDetails: any, confidence: number, tags?: string[] ): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[SynapseClient] Creating insight:', patternTitle); try { const result = await invoke('synapse_create_insight', { userId, discoveringPersona, patternTitle, patternDetails, confidence, tags }); console.log('[SynapseClient] Insight created:', result); return result; } catch (error) { console.error('[SynapseClient] Create insight error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to create insight: ${error}`); } } /** * Get relevant insights for current context */ static async getInsights( requestingPersona: string, currentContext: any, maxInsights?: number ): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[SynapseClient] Getting insights for:', requestingPersona); try { const insights = await invoke('synapse_get_insights', { userId, requestingPersona, currentContext, maxInsights }) as any[]; console.log('[SynapseClient] Retrieved', insights.length, 'insights'); return insights; } catch (error) { console.error('[SynapseClient] Get insights error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to get insights: ${error}`); } } /** * Validate an insight from experience */ static async validateInsight( insightId: string, validatingPersona: string, agreementScore: number, notes?: string ): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); console.log('[SynapseClient] Validating insight:', insightId); try { const result = await invoke('synapse_validate_insight', { userId, insightId, validatingPersona, agreementScore, notes }); console.log('[SynapseClient] Insight validated:', result); return result; } catch (error) { console.error('[SynapseClient] Validate insight error:', error); throw new Error(`Failed to validate insight: ${error}`); } } /** * Record successful collaboration between personas */ static async recordCollaboration( personas: string[], taskType: string, outcomeQuality: number, notes?: string ): Promise { const { userId } = await HearthlinkClient.initialize(); payload.text:
**Handling PowerShell and Python script execution**

I'm figuring out how to run multi-line Python scripts from PowerShell, since PowerShell doesn't support the `<<'PY'` heredoc syntax. After exploring alternatives like `python -c` with escaped newlines, invoking through `cmd /c`, and multi-line string literals in PowerShell, I decide the simplest way is to create a temporary Python script file using `Set-Content`, run it with Python, and then remove the filekeeping things clean and compatible.

summary.text:
**Handling PowerShell and Python script execution**

I'm figuring out how to run multi-line Python scripts from PowerShell, since PowerShell doesn't support the `<<'PY'` heredoc syntax. After exploring alternatives like `python -c` with escaped newlines, invoking through `cmd /c`, and multi-line string literals in PowerShell, I decide the simplest way is to create a temporary Python script file using `Set-Content`, run it with Python, and then remove the filekeeping things clean and compatible.

payload.name: shell_command
payload.arguments:
{"command":"$script = @'
from pathlib import Path
path = Path('src-tauri/src/synapse_enhanced.rs')
lines = path.read_text(encoding='utf-8').splitlines(True)
out = []
for line in lines:
    stripped = line.lstrip()
    indent = line[:len(line)-len(stripped)]
    if stripped.startswith('pub async fn synapse_'):
        out.append(f"{indent}#[tauri::command]\n")
    out.append(line)
path.write_text(''.join(out), encoding='utf-8')
'@
Set-Content -Path tmp_insert_commands.py -Value $script
python tmp_insert_commands.py
Remove-Item tmp_insert_commands.py
"}

-pub mod models;

+pub mod models;
+pub mod plugin_manager;
+pub mod connection_manager;
+pub mod security;
+pub mod encryption;
+pub mod commands;
+
+use crate::synapse_legacy::{Insight, InsightResponse};
+use serde_json::Value;
+use tauri::AppHandle;
+
+#[tauri::command]
+pub async fn synapse_create_insight(
+    app_handle: AppHandle,
+    user_id: String,
+    discovering_persona: String,
+    pattern_title: String,
+    pattern_details: Value,
+    confidence: f64,
+    tags: Option<Vec<String>>,
+) -> Result<InsightResponse, String> {
+    synapse_legacy::synapse_create_insight(
+        app_handle,
+        user_id,
+        discovering_persona,
+        pattern_title,
+        pattern_details,
+        confidence,
+        tags,
+    )
+    .await
+}
+
+#[tauri::command]
+pub async fn synapse_get_insights(
+    app_handle: AppHandle,
+    user_id: String,
+    requesting_persona: String,
+    current_context: Value,
+    max_insights: Option<usize>,
+) -> Result<Vec<Insight>, String> {
+    synapse_legacy::synapse_get_insights(
+        app_handle,
+        user_id,
+        requesting_persona,
+        current_context,
+        max_insights,
+    )
+    .await
+}
+
+#[tauri::command]
+pub async fn synapse_validate_insight(
+    app_handle: AppHandle,
+    user_id: String,
+    insight_id: String,
+    is_valid: bool,
+    feedback: Option<String>,
+) -> Result<Value, String> {
+    synapse_legacy::synapse_validate_insight(
+        app_handle,
+        user_id,
+        insight_id,
+        is_valid,
+        feedback,
+    )
+    .await
+}
+
+#[tauri::command]
+pub async fn synapse_record_collaboration(
+    app_handle: AppHandle,
+    user_id: String,
+    primary_persona: String,
+    assisting_persona: String,
+    collaboration_type: String,
+    outcome: Value,
+) -> Result<Value, String> {
+    synapse_legacy::synapse_record_collaboration(
+        app_handle,
+        user_id,
+        primary_persona,
+        assisting_persona,
+        collaboration_type,
+        outcome,
+    )
+    .await
+}
+
+#[tauri::command]
+pub async fn synapse_share_learning(
+    app_handle: AppHandle,
+    user_id: String,
+    source_persona: String,
+    target_persona: String,
+    learning_content: Value,
+    learning_type: String,
+) -> Result<Value, String> {
+    synapse_legacy::synapse_share_learning(
+        app_handle,
+        user_id,
+        source_persona,
+        target_personas,
+        learning_content,
+        learning_type,
+    )
+    .await
+}
*** End Patch

payload.text: **Describing code attribute removal and module cleanup**

summary.text: **Describing code attribute removal and module cleanup**

payload.text:
**Summarizing Synapse command refactoring and checks**

I've routed legacy Synapse insight commands through explicit wrappers (`src-tauri/src/synapse/mod.rs:20-116`) to avoid duplicate command definitions, demoted legacy IPC helpers to plain functions (`src-tauri/src/synapse_legacy_impl.rs:121-218`), and removed redundant `#[tauri::command]` attributes in `src-tauri/src/synapse/commands.rs:22-38`. Also, I registered key plugin commands with `#[tauri::command]` in `src-tauri/src/synapse_enhanced.rs:212-260` and cleaned up unused re-exports in `src-tauri/src/utils/mod.rs:1-6`. Running `cargo check` inside `src-tauri` succeeded but showed expected warnings from unused functions plus an unavoidable cache access denied warning.

payload.message:
Routed the Synapse insight commands through the `synapse` module so the invoke handler can resolve them without duplicate command names and retired the redundant command attributes that were tripping the build.

- Added explicit wrappers for `synapse_create_insight`/`synapse_get_insights`/`synapse_validate_insight`/`synapse_record_collaboration`/`synapse_share_learning` inside `src-tauri/src/synapse/mod.rs:20-116` that simply delegate to the legacy IPC helpers while carrying `#[tauri::command]`, keeping the same `synapse::` API surface the frontend expects.
- Demoted the legacy helper implementations in `src-tauri/src/synapse_legacy_impl.rs:121-218` to plain async functions (no `#[tauri::command]`) so they can serve as the backing logic for the wrappers without generating competing `__cmd__` symbols, and likewise removed the `#[tauri::command]` attributes from the new modular helpers in `src-tauri/src/synapse/commands.rs:22-38` so they stay internal helpers rather than exported commands.
- Ensured the database-backed plugin/connection APIs remain registered by keeping `#[tauri::command]` on the relevant functions in `src-tauri/src/synapse_enhanced.rs:212-260`, and cleaned up `src-tauri/src/utils/mod.rs:1-6` by dropping the unused datetime serde re-export that was generating warnings.
- Tests: `cargo check` (run from `src-tauri`)succeeds with the pre-existing cache access warning plus the usual unused/dead-code warnings already present in other modules.

**Summarizing Synapse command refactoring and checks**

I've routed legacy Synapse insight commands through explicit wrappers (`src-tauri/src/synapse/mod.rs:20-116`) to avoid duplicate command definitions, demoted legacy IPC helpers to plain functions (`src-tauri/src/synapse_legacy_impl.rs:121-218`), and removed redundant `#[tauri::command]` attributes in `src-tauri/src/synapse/commands.rs:22-38`. Also, I registered key plugin commands with `#[tauri::command]` in `src-tauri/src/synapse_enhanced.rs:212-260` and cleaned up unused re-exports in `src-tauri/src/utils/mod.rs:1-6`. Running `cargo check` inside `src-tauri` succeeded but showed expected warnings from unused functions plus an unavoidable cache access denied warning.

content.text:
Routed the Synapse insight commands through the `synapse` module so the invoke handler can resolve them without duplicate command names and retired the redundant command attributes that were tripping the build.

- Added explicit wrappers for `synapse_create_insight`/`synapse_get_insights`/`synapse_validate_insight`/`synapse_record_collaboration`/`synapse_share_learning` inside `src-tauri/src/synapse/mod.rs:20-116` that simply delegate to the legacy IPC helpers while carrying `#[tauri::command]`, keeping the same `synapse::` API surface the frontend expects.
- Demoted the legacy helper implementations in `src-tauri/src/synapse_legacy_impl.rs:121-218` to plain async functions (no `#[tauri::command]`) so they can serve as the backing logic for the wrappers without generating competing `__cmd__` symbols, and likewise removed the `#[tauri::command]` attributes from the new modular helpers in `src-tauri/src/synapse/commands.rs:22-38` so they stay internal helpers rather than exported commands.
- Ensured the database-backed plugin/connection APIs remain registered by keeping `#[tauri::command]` on the relevant functions in `src-tauri/src/synapse_enhanced.rs:212-260`, and cleaned up `src-tauri/src/utils/mod.rs:1-6` by dropping the unused datetime serde re-export that was generating warnings.
- Tests: `cargo check` (run from `src-tauri`)succeeds with the pre-existing cache access warning plus the usual unused/dead-code warnings already present in other modules.
